title: Describable Protocol
description:
Create a protocol that provides a description capability and implement it for multiple types.

## Requirements

1. Define a `Describable` protocol with a `description` property (read-only String)
2. Create a `Book` struct with `title` and `author` properties that conforms to `Describable`
3. Create a `Movie` struct with `title` and `director` properties that conforms to `Describable`
4. Add a protocol extension that provides a `printDescription()` method

## Expected Output

When you create instances and call `printDescription()`:

```
"1984" by George Orwell
"Inception" directed by Christopher Nolan
```

testCases.description: Describable protocol should be defined with description property
testCases.assertion: protocol Describable { var description: String { get } }

testCases.description: Book struct should conform to Describable
testCases.assertion: Book.self is Describable.Type || book is Describable

testCases.description: Movie struct should conform to Describable
testCases.assertion: Movie.self is Describable.Type || movie is Describable

testCases.description: Book description should include title and author
printDescription() should be available via protocol extension

hints: Define the protocol with: protocol Describable { var description: String { get } }
Use an extension to add the printDescription() method: extension Describable { func printDescription() { print(description) } }
For Book, the description could be: "\"\(title)\" by \(author)"
For Movie, the description could be: "\"\(title)\" directed by \(director)"
